etymology.description: semantic 女(女) (nǚ, "female, woman") + phonetic 未(未) (mèi) -> female sibling -> younger sister
etymology.interpretation: 妹(妹) (mèi, "younger sister") combines 女(女) (nǚ, "female, woman") to indicate gender, with 未(未) (mèi) as a phonetic component to guide pronunciation. This reflects the traditional familial structure where siblings are often distinguished by relative age.

examples.chinese: 昨天见到妹妹(昨天見到妹妹)，她笑得很开心(她笑得很開心)。
examples.pinyin: Zuótiān jiàndào mèimei, tā xiào dé hěn kāixīn.
examples.english: I saw my younger sister yesterday, and she was smiling happily.

examples.chinese: 我的妹妹喜欢画画(我的妹妹喜歡畫畫)，她梦想成为艺术家(她夢想成為藝術家)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ de mèimei xǐhuān huàhuà, tā mèngxiǎng chéngwéi yìshùjiā.
examples.english: My younger sister loves painting, and she dreams of becoming an artist.
